column5: Hwy 11 between Atikokan and Fort Frances is flooded out. There is no news as to when it will be reopened. Please phone OPP for travel info.
How far from Fort Francis is this problem? Is it before or after the 502 intersection?
All they say is west of Atikokan, also updated that hwy 502 is also closed at this time. Will give more info in the morning.

Hwy 11 30 km west of Atikokan, hwy 11 boulder slide near the Seine River, hwy 71 south of Soiux Narrows, hwy 502 south of Dryden, hwy 602 west of Fort Frances. hwy 11 should be reopened sometime later this afternoon. Her is the web site address for the Fort Frances newspaper for updates. http://www.fftimes.com/
Any more info on the roads.
Just spoke to a person in Vermillion Bay last night. Highway 11. 502 and 71 are closed until hopefully Friday, the 14th. she said there are alot of upset people who can't go anywhere south.

Heading up to Nestor falls on Friday for the musky opener--a local message board up there (Crawford's Resort) indicated that the rain they got over the weekend has closed the roads west of Fort Frances to highway 71, as well as highway 71 north (as of Tuesday, noon). Mike gave a number to call for highway information: in Canada it is 1-800-473-2030; in the US, it is 807-473-2100. Terry

We just had a bunch of rain again this evening. Highways are still out and my be for a while. Some of the highways have numerous washouts and water is still over some. The Lavalle Bridge West of Fort Frances has shifted so it is a right off. Be sure to call ahead before making any plans for a while.:( Note: Rainy Lake has risen more than 21/2 feet in just three days!
As of 1:55 PM Thursday, Hwy 11 from Fort Francis to EMO is open 1-lane only and Hwy 71 from EMO to Kenora is open 2-lanes with a short detour at Nestor Falls 1-807,473-2100 Option #1...........!
